intro: Codonanthe luteola, commonly known as the yellow codonanthe, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warmer climates.
